title: 1985년 Deisch 사건
summary: 미국 Oregon, OR 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Deisch. 판결일: 1985-08-14. 법원: Court of Appeals of Oregon.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: MURRAY WELL-DRILLING, Appellant, v. DEISCH Et Al, Defendants, STATE OF OREGON, Acting by and Through the DIRECTOR OF VETERANS’ AFFAIRS, Respondent; STATE OF OREGON, Acting by and Through the DIRECTOR OF VETERANS’ AFFAIRS, Respondent, v. DEISCH Et Al, Defendants, MURRAY WELL-DRILLING, INC., Appellant
**판결일**: 1985-08-14
**법원**: Court of Appeals of Oregon
**관할**: Oregon, OR

**판사**: Joseph, Young

## 변호인

Dave Frohnmayer, Attorney General, James E. Mountain, Jr., Solicitor General, and Richard D. Wasserman, Assistant Attorney General, Salem, for petition., No appearance contra.

## 인용

- 704 P.2d 1159
- 75 Or. App. 1

## 판결문 요약


704 P.2d 1159 (1985)
75 Or.App. 1
MURRAY WELL-DRILLING, an Oregon Corporation, Appellant,
v.
Chester V. DEISCH, Jr., and Alana D. Deisch, Defendants,
State of Oregon, Acting by and through the Director of Veterans' Affairs, Respondent.
State of Oregon, Acting by and through the Director of Veterans' Affairs, Respondent,
v.
Chester V. Deisch, Jr., and Alana D. Deisch, Defendants,
Murray Well-Drilling, Inc., Appellant.
CC83-179, CC83-294; CA A33850.
Court of Appeals of Oregon.
Submitted on Petition for Reconsideration February 13, 1985.
Filed January 9, 1985.
Decided August 14, 1985.
*1160 Dave Frohnmayer, Atty. Gen., James E. Mountain, Jr., Sol. Gen., and Richard D. Wasserman, Asst. Atty. Gen., Salem, for petition.
No appearance contra.
Before WARDEN, P.J., JOSEPH, C.J., and YOUNG, J.
Submitted on Respondent's Petition for Reconsideration February 13, 1985.
JOSEPH, Chief Judge.
The State of Oregon (DVA) has petitioned for review of our order dismissing this appeal. See ORAP 10.10(1). We grant the petition for reconsideration and adhere to the order.
The initial question is whether DVA is an "aggrieved party" within the meaning of ORS 2.520.[1] It appears from the judgment that DVA was the prevailing party at trial and that Murray Well-Drilling, Inc. (Murray) was the losing party. Murray filed a notice of appeal designating DVA as respondent. DVA did not file a notice of appeal or, after the filing of Murray's notice of appeal, a notice of cross-appeal. On our own motion, we d...
